2450/A0/05/004/002.status_value: On track. Annual 2012 Ombudsman report to Parliament was issued in the beginning of 2013. Chapter on child's rights violations was developed with UNICEF support. Also  research on torture and ill-treatment of children in juvenile justice system was conducted by Ombudsman office with UNICEF support. 36 cases of violation of the children's rights were registered by Ombudsman office from the beginning of 2013. One of them was a case that was reported by a child. By the end 2014 Ombudsman office wil
2450/A0/05/004/002.indicator_name: Status of the functioning of the Ombudsman Office to monitor and report on violation of child rights
2450/A0/05/004/002.headline: More data to develop child-centered policies and programmes in vaccination in Kyrgyzstan in 2016. Four monitoring visits and one Special report to Parliament on child rights violation by Ombudsman office.

2450/A0/05/004/002.status_value: National based on official statistics Trans-Monee database of indicators on situation of children and women was updated

2450/A0/05/003/002.status_value: 58 FGP and 105 FAPs  (163 health facilities of primary health care level -100%) in 23  providing information on anaemia and danger signs  and cover about  312 000 people.
2450/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: # of out of 23 municipalities where primary medical level facilities provide outreach programs on danger signs of pregnancy  child diseases and anaemia to poor and vulnerable families
2450/A0/05/003/002.headline: Child survival improved through upgrade and standardization of child resuscitation services and implementing of new type of mechanism for provision of health services to young children.

2450/A0/05/003/002.status_value: On track. 540 VHCs in all 180 villages in 23 municipalities are covered. In total  15660 mothers and caregivers of children under 5 have been received information on danger signs of child illnesses. According to UNICEF assessment  awareness on danger signs on child illnesses in the target villages has increased by 62%  in 2013  was 59.4%.
2450/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: : # of VHCs in 23 municipalities providing information on danger signs of child illnesses to families through outreach programs
2450/A0/05/003/002.headline: Child survival improved through upgrade and standardization of child resuscitation services and implementing of new type of mechanism for provision of health services to young children.

2450/A0/05/003/002.status_value: On track. 88% of CBKs (50/57) provide improved sanitation for children. Remaining 7 latrines are expected to be finished by the end of 2013. Children in 62% (33/53) of selected education institutions use improved latrines and are able to wash their hands with soap.  Contacting for renovation works in 4 out of 17 healthcare institutions ongoing. Tender materials for remaining 13 institutions are under preparation.
2450/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: % of schools  % of CBKs and % of Health Facilities in 23 municipalities with sustained sanitation and hand washing facilities and safe drinking water
2450/A0/05/003/002.headline: Child survival improved through upgrade and standardization of child resuscitation services and implementing of new type of mechanism for provision of health services to young children.

2450/A0/05/003/002.status_value: On track. 100% of selected CBKs  schools and kindergartens have been provided with UNICEF WASH guidebook and promotion materials. Training on use of promotion materials has also been conducted enabling teachers to improve hygiene behavior of children. Follow up monitoring on ensuring inclusion of WASH lessons in the syllabus has also taken place.
2450/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: % of schools and pre-schools in 23 municipalities that promote safe hygiene practices for children in line with UNICEF recommended standards
2450/A0/05/003/002.headline: Child survival improved through upgrade and standardization of child resuscitation services and implementing of new type of mechanism for provision of health services to young children.

2450/A0/05/003/002.status_value: On track. 540 VHCs in all 180 villages in 23 municipalities are covered. In total  5470 pregnant women have been received information on danger signs in pregnancy. According to UNICEF assessment  awareness in the target villages has increased. Compared to the baseline situation  knowledge of women on danger signs of pregnancy has increased by 96.2% against 77% in 2013. SMS-based monitoring system is applied to track changes in mothers' awareness on danger signs
2450/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: # of Village Health Committees (VHCs) in 23 municipalities providing information on complicated signs of pregnancy to pregnant women through outreach programs
2450/A0/05/003/002.headline: Child survival improved through upgrade and standardization of child resuscitation services and implementing of new type of mechanism for provision of health services to young children.

2450/A0/05/003/001.status_value: Baseline: 9 out of 23 municipalities allocate minimal funding for their emergency preparedness plans. On track: Seventeen municipalities out of 23 municipalities allocate minimal level of funding (15% average) for emergency preparedness plans. It is evidenced that max $2000/year allocated to the emergency preparedness plans implementation  which is not enough. All 17 municipalities out of 23 were trained on the strategic planning  budget allocation  including for DRR.

2450/A0/05/003/007.status_value: On track: Twenty two municipalities out of 23 raised their capacity on strategic planning  budget allocation  including for DRR  risks and vulnerabilities assessment and analysis.
2450/A0/05/003/007.indicator_name: # of municipalities which have partial funding for their emergency preparedness and DRR plans
2450/A0/05/003/007.headline: UNICEF Kyrgyzstan supported the Ministry of Emergency Situations and the Ministry of Education and Science in promoting child-sensitive disaster risk management in the country.
2450/A0/05/003/007.baseline_value: 9 out of 23 municipalities allocate up to 7% funding for their emergency preparedness plans.

2450/A0/05/003/007.status_value: On track. Twenty two municipalities out of 23 have capacity to plan and implement their DRR plans in line with the National strategy for comprehensive safety and security of population and territories. UNICEF and the Ministry of Emergency Situations are working on Disaster Risk Analysis and piloted this approach in two municipalities.
2450/A0/05/003/007.indicator_name: # of municipalities that implement and monitor emergency preparedness and DRR plans with involvement of CSOs
2450/A0/05/003/007.headline: UNICEF Kyrgyzstan supported the Ministry of Emergency Situations and the Ministry of Education and Science in promoting child-sensitive disaster risk management in the country.
2450/A0/05/003/007.baseline_value: 11 out of 23 municipalities developed and implement emergency preparedness plans

2450/A0/05/003/007.status_value: On track: All schools have included the lessons on DRR  principles of everyday safety for grades 1-5  based on formal school curriculum. A model of DRR Resource School tested in Batken. This enabled school's administration  teachers  children and their parents to implement school based risk reduction and preparedness works effectively. Two manuals for 6-11 grades on DRR are developed  including on DRR inclusive education.
2450/A0/05/003/007.indicator_name: % of schools and pre-schools in 23 municipalities that include safe behaviour/DRR issues in curricula
2450/A0/05/003/007.headline: UNICEF Kyrgyzstan supported the Ministry of Emergency Situations and the Ministry of Education and Science in promoting child-sensitive disaster risk management in the country.
2450/A0/05/003/007.baseline_value: 14% of schools and preschools included safe behavior/DRR issues in curricula according to KAPB survey

2450/A0/05/003/007.status_value: The Principles of Everyday Safety subject is included in the national curricular. However  the Ministry of Education and Science has been revising the curriculum and planned provision of the Principles of Everyday Safety in 6-11 grades as extra-curricular classes. UNICEF advocated to maintain the classes in the national curriculum for all grades  as extra-curricular classes may not give the same level of focus  understanding and DRR skills to children  which is important considering the country
2450/A0/05/003/007.indicator_name: "Peacebuilding  conflict and/or disaster risk reduction integrated in national curricula in primary and secondary education"
2450/A0/05/003/007.headline: UNICEF Kyrgyzstan supported the Ministry of Emergency Situations and the Ministry of Education and Science in promoting child-sensitive disaster risk management in the country.
2450/A0/05/003/007.baseline_value: Peacebuilding  Conflict and DRR are fragmented and irregularly tought at schools
2450/A0/05/003/007.target_value: Peacebuilding and DRR (Principles of Everyday Safety subject) are included in the national curricular

2450/A0/05/003/008.status_value: On track. 50 schools  participating in the WASH in Schools project  were directly assisted through the construction and renovation of WASH facilities. Construction has been used as an incentive. Only those schools that demonstrated commitment to prioritize school WASH and maintained daily group handwashing received an investment to infrastructure.  An additional 12 CBK's have new toilet and hand-washing facilities plus additional support (civil improvements  playgrounds etc). WASH renovation wor
2450/A0/05/003/008.indicator_name: % of schools  % of CBKs and % Health Facilities in 23 municipalities with sustained sanitation and hand washing facilities and safe drinking water.
2450/A0/05/003/008.headline: UNICEF Kyrgyzstan advocated for improving access to water  sanitation and hygiene in schools for better health and education outcomes for children  especially girls. Country Office supported capacity building of development partners 10 healthcare institutions in improving their water supply and sanitation facilities for children and pregnant women.

2450/A0/05/003/008.status_value: On track. in 2016 schools and preschools of target municipalities maintained WASH promotion activities among children. UNICEF and implementing partner held a formative research on current menstrual hygiene management (MHM) practices and barriers girls face at school with regards to WASH. Basic package of materials on MHM has been developed and teachers from 100 schools were trained on hygiene promotion and incremental improvements. This capacity building activities enabled them to make school WA

2450/A0/05/002/001.status_value: On track. Optimization Plan on the Management and Financing of Residential Institutions for 2013-2016 has been endorsed in December 2012. Transformation plans for all institutions supported by UNICEF are developed to implement OP. Decree on transformation of infant homes is issued. First FTH for 8 children with disabilities from closed Pokrovka institution is established. Partly funds of Pokrovka institution are allocated for the FTH by MoSD.

2450/A0/05/001/001.status_value: UNICEF provides support to the MOH to conduct study to analyze reasons for refusal from immunization. Currently all preparatory work is going on and survey will be conducted in Autumn.

2450/A0/05/001/001.headline: Comprehensive and coordinated approach to accelerate results in the area of Child Health and Child Survival is to increase access and utilization of quality health services by the most vulnerable children .
2450/A0/05/001/001.baseline_value: Health promotion units exist but lack capacity

2450/A0/05/001/001.status_value: first time this M&E center collected  aggregated  analyzed and presented data related to MCH at JAR SWAP meeting in April 2017. Currently Roster of experts is under the development to provide immediate information on the list of available experts in different MCH areas  their competencies   reports and feedback from supervised facilities
2450/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: Status of development of the Ministry of Health (MOH) monitoring system
2450/A0/05/001/001.headline: Comprehensive and coordinated approach to accelerate results in the area of Child Health and Child Survival is to increase access and utilization of quality health services by the most vulnerable children .
2450/A0/05/001/001.baseline_value: MOH monitoring system is fragmented and incomplete

2450/A0/05/001/001.status_value: 95% of maternity wards in pilot areas of UNICEF are covered by EPC. currently main focus is on monitoring and supervising visits of this pilot facilities in order to improve the quality of provided services. To improve coordination on a level of each health facility  the monitorings of EPC are integrated with monitorings on IMCI.
2450/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: : % of maternity wards providing perinatal services in line with international standards in the framework of effective perinatal care
2450/A0/05/001/001.headline: Comprehensive and coordinated approach to accelerate results in the area of Child Health and Child Survival is to increase access and utilization of quality health services by the most vulnerable children .

2450/A0/05/001/001.status_value: On track. UNICEF supported MoH in implementation of Early Infant Diagnosis on HIV among newborns. MoH developed guideline and SOPs for EID. From the beginning of the year 15 children under 6 months born to HIV+ mothers were tested on HIV using DBS methodology  which consist 40%.
2450/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: % of infants born to HIV positive mothers who receive viral testing on primary level/AIDS center in the first 2 months of life
2450/A0/05/001/001.headline: Comprehensive and coordinated approach to accelerate results in the area of Child Health and Child Survival is to increase access and utilization of quality health services by the most vulnerable children .

2450/A0/05/001/001.status_value: 61% of primary health care facilities nationally are equipped by standard refrigerators based on WHO standard requirements. This result was achieved due to advocacy of UNICEF to allocate funds from SWAP budget to procure refrigerators.
2450/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: % of primary health care facilities managing cold chain system according to national standards
2450/A0/05/001/001.headline: Comprehensive and coordinated approach to accelerate results in the area of Child Health and Child Survival is to increase access and utilization of quality health services by the most vulnerable children .

2450/A0/05/001/002.status_value: Achieved. 480-hour school readiness program is funded and introduced for all schools and being taught starting from September 2015.
2450/A0/05/001/002.indicator_name: Status of inclusion of the school readiness programme into the NEP with focus on the most marginalized and the funding status
2450/A0/05/001/002.headline: Early Learning Development Standards for 0-3 and 3-7 years old children will be integrated into the existing in-service and pre-service training system of preschool workers and medical staff.
2450/A0/05/001/002.baseline_value: Medium Term Education Plan for 2012-2014 (the school readiness is a priority area)

2450/A0/05/001/002.status_value: On track. Study of 2011 teacher salary reform impacts on education quality showed that qualified teachers were returned or attracted to the system. However  due to flattening of the career ladder  number of teachers quitting the job increased by 2014. So in 2015 UNICEF supported MOES in development of a Regulation on Teacher qualification and appraisal system  which is currently submitted for Government's approval.
2450/A0/05/001/002.indicator_name: % of qualified pre-school and school teachers who teach in their area of expertise (by gender  area  age  subject)
2450/A0/05/001/002.headline: Early Learning Development Standards for 0-3 and 3-7 years old children will be integrated into the existing in-service and pre-service training system of preschool workers and medical staff.
2450/A0/05/001/002.baseline_value: 77% in basic education  not available for pre-school

2450/A0/05/001/002.status_value: On track. EMIS concept note developed in 2015 with UNICEF support has been approved at MOES decision making board in September 2015. It will be presented to the Governmental experts group working for introduction of e-government project. The child level database of school and preschool education institutes supported by UNICEF was recognized as an optimal platform for EMIS in the country.
2450/A0/05/001/002.indicator_name: Availability of accurate and reliable data on pre-school  out-of-school children and learning environment in pre-school and basic education  and status of utilization by decision makers
2450/A0/05/001/002.headline: Early Learning Development Standards for 0-3 and 3-7 years old children will be integrated into the existing in-service and pre-service training system of preschool workers and medical staff.
2450/A0/05/001/002.baseline_value: The current system is not sufficient to collect data on out-of school children  the data is fragmented and insufficient (Source: Concept Note on EMIS  Sep 2011)
